{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3148577,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T16:57:44.727Z","cooked":"

We are trying to use Motion Magic to set the position of an arm. When we start the motion, the motor starts to move in the proper direction but it starts and stops until it gets to the position. It doesn’t oscillate. It just starts and stops. I’m guessing I have something in the config not setup right but I’m not seeing it. Any ideas what to check?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-19T16:57:44.727Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":55.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427389,"topic_slug":"motion-magic-sputtering-to-position","display_username":"khope","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31620,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4779 - The RoboSapiens"},"post_url":"/t/motion-magic-sputtering-to-position/427389/1","custom_user_title":"4779 - The RoboSapiens","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3148580,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T17:17:51.765Z","cooked":"

I suspect the “start and stop” behavior you’re describing IS oscillation, but with a too-low feed forward value.

Can you graph the commanded motor outputs? This should show the oscillation regardless of what the mechanism is actually doing.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-19T17:19:00.461Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427389,"topic_slug":"motion-magic-sputtering-to-position","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/motion-magic-sputtering-to-position/427389/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148584,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T17:33:06.939Z","cooked":"

We did plot the output voltage and it would go up and then down and then back up. Never negative. We are actually running on a motor now that has nothing attached to its shaft and we are getting the same response. Would it need a feed-forward value in the PID to make it work smoothly? When we added in a feed-forward, we would actually see an oscillation of forward and backward movement.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-19T17:33:06.939Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":20.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427389,"topic_slug":"motion-magic-sputtering-to-position","display_username":"khope","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31620,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4779 - The RoboSapiens"},"post_url":"/t/motion-magic-sputtering-to-position/427389/3","custom_user_title":"4779 - The RoboSapiens","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148605,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T18:07:05.794Z","cooked":"

Wait, you’re seeing the same behavior with no load attached…? Okay, that’s likely different then.

If you have a screenshot of that graph to share, it could be helpful. Also, if you could share your code (ideally as a link to Github or similar), that would definitely be helpful as well.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-19T18:07:05.794Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":26.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427389,"topic_slug":"motion-magic-sputtering-to-position","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31620,"username":"khope","name":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/motion-magic-sputtering-to-position/427389/4","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148609,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T18:11:52.992Z","cooked":"

Is there anything else running that could be commanding the motors at the same time?

What did you use for your kP calculation?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-19T18:11:52.992Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":10.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427389,"topic_slug":"motion-magic-sputtering-to-position","display_username":"NewtonCrosby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31346,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/motion-magic-sputtering-to-position/427389/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148610,"name":"Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374","username":"msonnier","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msonnier/{size}/199751_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T18:12:17.094Z","cooked":"

Any chance you have another motor (e.gi. in a different subsystem) with the same CAN ID? Some other code somewhere else setting the motor to 0 power?

Or alternatively, did you forget to “addRequirement” for your command for the subsystem, and there is a command running in parallel also commanding that same motor (e.g. a default command to stop the motor)?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-19T18:12:17.094Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427389,"topic_slug":"motion-magic-sputtering-to-position","display_username":"Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22056,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2992, FTC 14374, FTC 10337(former)"},"post_url":"/t/motion-magic-sputtering-to-position/427389/6","custom_user_title":"FRC 2992, FTC 14374, FTC 10337(former)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148638,"name":"mbhoxsie","username":"mbhoxsie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mbhoxsie/{size}/10287_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T18:53:42.475Z","cooked":"

we tracked the problem down to too high of a kP setting. We thought that it would only affect it as it was nearing it setpoint and not throughout.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-19T18:53:42.475Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":14.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427389,"topic_slug":"motion-magic-sputtering-to-position","display_username":"mbhoxsie","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22056,"username":"msonnier","name":"Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msonnier/{size}/199751_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34100,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/motion-magic-sputtering-to-position/427389/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148673,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T20:09:02.260Z","cooked":"


eah. We were starting off with a kP value of .7 and trying to go from position 0 to 80,000. We looked at last year’s code in which we were doing something similar and saw that we had a kP of .05. So once we backed it off, it was much smoother. I always thought that too much kP would cause oscillation at that end and didn’t realize that it would cause problems if motion magic had too high of a kP set. Since we were oscillating at the end, we only considered increasing kP

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-19T20:09:02.260Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":37,"readers_count":36,"score":12.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427389,"topic_slug":"motion-magic-sputtering-to-position","display_username":"khope","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":34100,"username":"mbhoxsie","name":"mbhoxsie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mbhoxsie/{size}/10287_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31620,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4779 - The RoboSapiens"},"post_url":"/t/motion-magic-sputtering-to-position/427389/8","custom_user_title":"4779 - The RoboSapiens","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148757,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-19T22:26:22.787Z","cooked":"
khope:

… I always thought that too much kP would cause oscillation at that end and didn’t realize that it would cause problems if motion magic had too high of a kP set. …

I actually just ran across this a week or so ago with our team.

See this little nugget of information in this documentation page:

If using motion profiling or Motion Magic, closed loop error is calculated against the current target, and not the “final” target at the end of the profile/movement.

I was trying to use getClosedLoopError() to decide whether our command had finished running but it kept ending immediately. Then found that little gem of information, which made a lot more sense explaining why things like increasing kP had a small effect on the actual output of MotionMagic.
